'''Hypno''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''スリーパー''' ''Sleeper'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Drowzee}} starting at [[level]] 26.

==Biology==
Hypno is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon that has yellow skin. It has two triangular, ears on the top of its head and two sleepy looking eyes with a large nose underneath. On its neck, it has a ruff of white fur, which is longer on the female. Hypno has five fingers on each hand and holds a pendulum in its left. The pendulum is used for hypnotism, and Hypno is never seen without it. There are three toes on each of its feet, which have a pink pad on the undersides.

Hypno is able to put people to sleep. It can then sense the dreams the victim is having, so it knows what kind of dream it would be eating. It is known to reside away from humans and on {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|less traveled roads}}. If anyone comes by, Hypno will hypnotize them and eat their dreams. While it awaits its prey, it polishes its pendulum.

==In the anime==
[[File:Faba Hypno.png|thumb|left|220px|Hypno in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Hypno debuted in ''[[EP027|Hypno's Naptime]]''. The Pokémon Lover's Club of [[HopHopHop Town]] were using Hypno and {{p|Drowzee}} to help them with their sleeping problems. The "Sleep Waves" from Hypno were causing children to act like Pokémon and draining the energy from the Pokémon in the local [[Pokémon Center]]. Drowzee managed to fix this problem.

A Hypno appeared in ''[[EP271|Playing with Fire]]'', under the ownership of {{jo|Harrison}}. He used it against {{Ash}} during the [[Silver Conference]], and it was able to defeat {{AP|Totodile}} before losing to {{AP|Snorlax}}.

A Hypno appeared in ''[[AG146|Fear Factor Phony]]''. It lived in an abandoned mining colony with several other Pokémon of {{t|Psychic|its type}}.

A Hypno appeared in ''[[SM049|Mission: Total Recall!]]'', under the ownership of [[Faba]] where it attempted to wipe {{an|Lillie}}'s memories. It later reappeared in [[SM055]].

===Minor appearances===
A Hypno appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

A Hypno was one of the Pokémon living in [[Len Town]] in ''[[EP156|The Psychic Sidekicks!]]''.

A Hypno appeared in ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', where it participated in [[Pokémon Beauty Contest|a Pokémon breeding competition]].

A Hypno appeared at the [[Pokémon Jujitsu Academy]] in ''[[EP176|Ariados, Amigos]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer named [[Mickey]]. It was defeated by {{OBP|Ralph|EP176}}'s {{p|Houndour}}.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Hypno appeared in ''[[AG162|Spontaneous Combusken!]]'', where it participated in the [[Chrysanthemum Island]] [[Pokémon Contest]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Al Hypno Adventures.png|thumb|170px|Hypno in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
Hypno's debut appearance in ''[[PS056|The Coming of Slowpoke (Eventually)]]'' as one of the Pokémon of [[Al]] of the [[Team Rocket]] trio that attempted to recapture [[S.S. Anne]].

A Hypno was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]] in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]''.

A Hypno belonging to the Battle Factory appeared in ''[[PS305|Interesting Interactions Involving Illumise]]''.

A Hypno appeared in [[PASM13]].

[[Faba]]'s Hypno first appeared in the {{chap|Sun & Moon}}.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
[[Sabrina]] signed up her Hypno to perform on stage at the No. 1 Pokémon competition in ''[[PM019|Aim to be the No. 1 Pokémon!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Gold & Silver: The Golden Boys manga===
[[Eusine]] owns a Hypno in the manga.

==In the TCG==
{{main|Hypno (TCG)}}

==Merchandise==
Hypno was one of the first four Pokémon designs revealed when the [[Pokémon 151]] brand was first announced. The shirt design features an image of Hypno swinging its pendulum from the left side of the shirt.

==Trivia==
* Hypno's Red, Blue, and LeafGreen Pokédex entries make reference to it using "PSI moves", possibly indicating an early name for the {{t|Psychic}} type in English.

===Origin===
Hypno is based on a {{wp|tapir}}, hypnotist, and {{wp|baku (spirit)|baku}}, or dream eater spirit, of Japanese mythology. It also looks similar to a {{wp|proboscis monkey}}. Hypno's long, hooked nose and white frill could also be based on a vulture, such as {{wp|Rüppell's Vulture}}.

====Name origin====
Hypno is a shortening of ''{{wp|hypnosis}}''. It could also be derived from {{wp|Hypnos}} (Greek: '''Ὕπνος''' ''Sleep''), the personification of sleep in Greek mythology.

Sleeper is literally ''sleeper'', one who sleeps.
